guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors should adhere to the project's code of conduct to ensure a welcoming and inclusive community. This includes respecting others, accepting constructive feedback, and being considerate of different viewpoints.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: When reporting issues, contributors should provide clear, detailed, and reproducible steps to demonstrate the problem. This helps maintainers effectively understand and address the issues.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Contributors are encouraged to submit pull requests with concise, well-documented code. Pull requests should include a description of the changes, related issue numbers, and any additional notes for the reviewers.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Commit messages should be meaningful and descriptive to help others understand the changes made. Follow the project's commit message guidelines for format and content.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Before submitting code, contributors should ensure their changes are thoroughly tested. Include automated tests where applicable, and verify that existing tests pass without issues.

guidelines.title: Coding Style
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding style guidelines to maintain consistency throughout the codebase. This includes following naming conventions, formatting rules, and best practices.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Contributors should update or add documentation as necessary, making sure that new features or changes are well-explained. This helps other users and developers understand and use the project effectively.
